alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Coastal Waldo; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 14 at 3:49PM EDT until March 15 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM CONTINUES INTO WEDNESDAY... .Strengthening low pressure remains in the Gulf of Maine into tomorrow with snow continuing the remainder of today and into tonight. Greatest snowfall will likely fall at higher terrain across the Monadnocks, Sunapee, the Ossippees, and White Mountains. At lower elevations, heavy and wet snow is expected, likely causing additional scattered power outages. Gusty northeast to north winds of 40 to 55 mph this afternoon and evening could accentuate the power outage risk. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 4 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
